Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm

Interface ComponentVirtualMachineI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DistributedComponentVirtualMachineI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCVM, AbstractDistributedCVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM, DistributedCVM
    public interface ComponentVirtualMachineI
    The interface ComponentVirtualMachineI defines the common behaviours of component virtual machines for component-based applications.

    Description

    A CVM is meant to create a set of components, to initialise and to interconnect them before starting them to execute the application. Applications can include concurrent components, which themselves rely on the Java Executor framework to execute requests with their own pool of threads. Hence, CVM also expose part of the ExecutorService interface regarding the life cycle of components and therefore their own life cycle.

    Invariant

     invariant              true            // TODO

    Created on : 2011-11-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDeployedComponent​(java.lang.String componentURI, ComponentI component)
      add a component to the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean allFinalised()
      return true if the CVM has been finalised (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean allStarted()
      return true if the CVM has been started (i.e. all of the locally statically deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean awaitTermination​(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void deploy()
      instantiate, publish and interconnect the components.
      boolean deploymentDone()
      return true if the deployment has been done.
      void doPortConnection​(java.lang.String componentURI, java.lang.String outboundPortURI, java.lang.String inboundPortURI, java.lang.String connectorClassname)
      connect the given outbound port of the given component to the inbound port of another component using the given connector class to instantiate the connector.
      void doPortDisconnection​(java.lang.String componentURI, java.lang.String outboundPortURI)
      disconnect the given outbound port of the given component.
      void execute()
      check if all of the deployed component have been started and perform the execute method on all of the deployed components, calling it as an asynchronous task.

      make the execute method of the component run as a task.

      true if the initialisation has been done.

 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • awaitTermination

        boolean awaitTermination​(long timeout,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.

               throws java.lang.Exception
        connect the given outbound port of the given component to the inbound port of another component using the given connector class to instantiate the connector.

         pre    componentURI != null
 pre    outboundPortURI != null
 pre    inboundPortURI != null

        Parameters:
        componentURI - URI of the component reflection inbound port.
        outboundPortURI - URI of the outbound port of the component.
        inboundPortURI - URI of the inbound port of the other component.
        connectorClassname - name of the class instantiating the connector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
